definitions.definition: one of the smaller groups or amounts that a larger group or amount can be divided into:
examples: People over the age of 85 make up the fastest-growing segment of the population.

definitions.definition: part of a circle that is divided from the rest by a line, or part of a sphere that is divided from the rest by two planes
one of the small parts that a fruit such as an orange is naturally divided into:
examples: The salad was decorated with segments of orange.

definitions.definition: a short piece of film that forms part of a television or radio programme, or that is broadcast on the internet:
examples: CNN last week broadcast a segment on homicides in the city.

definitions.definition: to divide something into different parts:
examples: The market is segmented by price into three general categories.
